intro: Urostachys funckii, commonly known as the Funck's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with dense foliage, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in dry conditions with minimal irrigation.
